form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Begich introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow a credit for the purchase of heating and cooling equipment which meets the Energy Star program requirements and is used in certain high-cost energy communities, and for other purposes.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Energy Efficient Heating and Cooling Tax Credit Act
.

section.header: Credit for conversion of home heating using oil fuel to using natural gas or biomass feedstocks

subsection.text: Subsection (a) of section 25C of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (relating to nonbusiness energy property) is amended by striking and at the end of paragraph (1), by striking the period at the end of paragraph (2) and inserting , and, and by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: the amount of the qualifying heating conversion expenditures paid or incurred by the taxpayer during such taxable year.

subparagraph.text: Subsection (b) of section 25C of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Limitation on qualifying heating conversion expenditures
paragraph.text: The amount of the credit allowed under this section by reason of paragraph (3) of subsection (a) for any taxable year with respect to any taxpayer shall not exceed $5,000.

subparagraph.text: Paragraph (1) of section 25C(b) of such Code is amended by inserting by reason of paragraphs (1) and (2) of subsection (a) after The credit allowed under this section.

paragraph.text: Section 25C(e) of such Code (relating to special rules) is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

No amount taken into account for purposes of determining a credit under this section by reason of paragraph (3) of subsection (a) shall be taken into account for purposes of determining a credit under this section by reason of paragraphs (1) and (2) of subsection (a).

subsection.text: Section 25C of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (relating to residential energy property expenditures) is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

paragraph.text: The term qualifying heating conversion expenditures means expenditures made by the taxpayer for qualified heating conversion property whichâ€”

subparagraph.text: meets the requirements of subparagraphs (A) and (B) of subsection (d)(1), and

is used as a heating or cooling system on a building or structure located in a community (as determined under section 19(a)(1) of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936) in which the average residential expenditure for home energy is more than 200 percent of the national average residential expenditure for home energy (as determined by the Energy Information Agency using the most recent data available).

paragraph.text: The term qualifying heating conversion expenditures includes expendituresâ€”

subparagraph.text: for labor costs properly allocable to the onsite preparation, assembly, or original installation of property described in paragraph (1), including fuel service connection installation costs specifically related to fuel service to the qualified energy property used in such conversion, and
the removal of the fuel oil equipment (including any storage tank) for such a building or structure.

paragraph.text: Such term does not include expenditures for soil cleanup.
For purposes of paragraph (1), the term qualified heating conversion property means property whichâ€”

subparagraph.text: is placed in service before January 1, 2019,
meets the performance and quality standards described in subsection (d)(2)(B), and
is a product which qualifies under the Energy Star program and meets the requirements for such property under such program.

subsection.text: Subsection (g) of section 25C of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (relating to termination) is amended by striking This section and inserting Paragraphs (1) and (2) of subsection (a) .
The amendments made by this section shall apply to property placed in service after the date of the enactment of this Act.
